Description: Bone needle with a bone case. The needle is perforated at the wider end and has a large round eye, and the tip is broken. The case is open at both ends, polished and sintered at the top edge to harden.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (pl. xxvii.1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
